list_definition.mean_english: chạy hoặc tránh xe, chạy thoát

list_ex_of_english: He was surprised that the population had fled.
They expected that those who fled would be unemployed and dependent on soup kitchens.
What makes it "global" beyond aiming at fleeing the country and seeking any future beyond the national borders?
Shut out and denied, this violence fled in two directions: into the future, and into the landscape.
Thousands were prosecuted and fined, many died, and some fled abroad.
Most often, the captives resisted, and they and their oppressors negotiated a modus vivendi ; when this broke down or proved impossible, the captives fled.
One million soldiers and half a million civilians fled.
Eventually most of the population from the different villages, expecting to be attacked, either fled or assembled in the ravines to offer some kind of resistance.
